name: Aviator
headline: Google-level engineering productivity suite
description:
Aviator is a developer tool that automates merge workflows and keeps builds healthy. Engineers save up to 5 hours a week and avoid frustration of broken builds.

Our users include Slack, Bosch, Lightspeed, Square, Benchling, Figma and many others. For instance, Slack went from 180 master-build failures per quarter to just 1 build failure when they started using Aviator.

Our goal is to become the leading brand for developer experience.

founders.name: Ankit Jain, Founder
founders.description: Ankit was an eng lead at Sunshine, Homejoy and Shippo, and he also leads the ex-Google alumni network (Xoogler.co). Prior to that, Ankit was also an EIR at Unshackled and an engineer at Google and Adobe.

generated_description:
### Aviator: Revolutionizing Developer Efficiency

**Company Overview**  
Aviator is on a mission to become the go-to engineering productivity suite, akin to what Google offers its engineers. Founded in 2021 and an alumnus of Y Combinator Batch S21, Aviator is headquartered in San Francisco and currently operates with a compact team of 6.

**What They Do**  
Initially designed as a developer tool for automating merge workflows, Aviator has matured into a comprehensive suite aimed at streamlining the developer experience. Their tools help engineers save up to 5 hours a week by maintaining healthy builds and automating monotonous tasks. Noteworthy clients like Slack, Bosch, Lightspeed, Square, Benchling, and Figma have already seen transformative impacts—Slack, for instance, reduced their master build failures from a staggering 180 per quarter to just one after implementing Aviator.

**Core Offerings**  
- **MergeQueue**: A highly customizable merge queue designed to keep builds green at scale.
- **Stacked PRs**: An open-source CLI tool facilitating the management of stacked pull requests on GitHub.
- **FlexReview Teams**: An innovative framework that speeds up code review cycles without sacrificing security.
- **Releases Dashboard**: A centralized tool to manage deployments, rollbacks, and more across various environments.

**Community and Resources**
Aviator also embraces community engagement through "The Hangar," a forum for discussions among developer-experience enthusiasts. This space connects senior professionals from companies like Slack, Google, and Docker to exchange insights and troubleshoot challenges.

**Why Choose Aviator?**  
With a charming blend of productivity-enhancing features, developers can tackle the complexities of large code repositories with confidence. Aviator's platform integrates seamlessly with existing build tools like Bazel, NX, and Gradle, effectively scaling developer workflows from code writing to deployment.

**Contact and Explore More**
For those intrigued by Aviator's offerings, getting started is a straightforward process. Interested parties can begin for free or request a demo on their [website](https://aviator.co).

In essence, Aviator is carving a niche for itself in streamlining developer workflows, making it easier for teams—be they startups or enterprise giants—to enhance their efficiency and productivity. Curious developers, take a look; your new favorite tool might just be a click away!
